td.italic: Fresh aerial parts of the plants (leaves, flowers and stems) were homogenized and the essential oil was extracted by hydrodistillation for 4 h in a Clevenger apparatus. Biological assays on Lucilia cuprina performed as described in the companion paper
Essential oil extraction and chemical characterization.
Establishment of Lucilia cuprina colonies; and biological assays on laboratory conditions (27± 2 °C and 70% relative humidity).
Contact tests using filter paper impregnated with Tagetes minuta essential oil.
Cuticular damage and larvae motility were reported.
Araquari, Santa Catarina, Brazil; 26°23′ 33.6691″ S and 48° 44′ 18.3336″ W.
Data is displayed within this article.
This Data in Brief article is submitted as a companion paper to:

Chaaban, A., Santos, V.M.C., Martins, C.E.N., Brum, J.S., Bertoldi, F.C., Molento, M.B. Tissue damage and cytotoxic effects of Tagetes minuta essential oil against Lucilia cuprina. Experimental Parasitology
